title: The I.M.F. said $1.3 billion in emergency funding for Ukraine had been approved by its board.
Biden Warns of Nuclear Risk and Says Putin Needs an ‘Off-Ramp’
description: President Biden’s aides have been debating whether there might be a way out for the wounded Russian leader.

title: Haiti Appeals for Armed Intervention and Aid to Quell Chaos
description: Prime Minister Ariel Henry and his government asked the international community to step in, largely to control gang violence that has ravaged the capital.

title: Its Army in Retreat, Russia Strikes Multiple Ukrainian Cities
description: On Vladimir V. Putin’s 70th birthday, his faltering military continued to show that it could use its advantage in long-range munitions to rain death and destruction far from the battlefield.

title: Nobel Peace Prize Winners Share a Past Shadowed by Russian Abuses
description: Democracy advocates from Belarus, Russia and Ukraine were jointly awarded the world’s most prestigious peace prize, an implicit condemnation of the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine and repression at home.

title: US Targets Businessmen and Companies in New North Korea Sanctions
description: The Biden administration is bracing for Kim Jong-un to carry out a nuclear test. It says North Korea has fired 41 ballistic missiles this year, including one over Japan.

title: Fire Causes ‘Irreparable’ Damage to Easter Island Statues
description: The fire has burned more than 247 acres of the Pacific island, where hundreds of haunting monolithic statues, called moai, have stood for centuries.

title: Shelling again damages power lines at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.
White House Tightens Rules on Counterterrorism Drone Strikes
description: A classified new policy requires President Biden’s approval to add suspected terrorists to a kill list. The Trump administration had decentralized control over targeting decisions.

title: After Day Care Massacre, Thailand Is Roiled With Grief
description: Anguished families were coming to terms with the loss of their young children as the nation pondered issues like gun violence and the widespread availability of deadly weapons.

title: Memorial Shed Light on Russia’s Past and Current Repressions
description: Members of the group have paid for their work with their lives and their freedom.

title: Liverpool Will Host 2023 Eurovision Song Contest
description: The popular competition would have been held in Ukraine, which won this year’s event, but safety concerns sent it to Britain instead.

title: In Ukraine, Sharing the Nobel Peace Prize Prompts Backlash
description: Some saw the decision to group a Ukrainian organization with human rights defenders from Russia and Belarus — two of the country’s aggressors — as an affront.

title: In Ukraine, the sharing of the prize prompts some backlash.
description: Some saw the decision to group a Ukrainian organization with human rights defenders from Russia and Belarus — two of the country’s aggressors — as an affront.

title: Europe’s Energy Crisis Exposes Old Fault Lines and New Power Dynamics
description: Smaller countries see Germany’s domestic largess to tackle spiraling energy costs as undermining the effort to lower fuel prices for the wider European Union.

title: Putin’s 70th Birthday Is Hailed in Russia and Derided in Ukraine
description: Russian newspapers lauded Mr. Putin’s leadership, comparing him to Peter the Great and Leonid Brezhnev. Some Ukrainians said they hoped the birthday would be his last.

title: Tropical Storm Julia Forms in the Caribbean
description: The storm, which was expected to reach hurricane strength over the weekend, was lashing the Guajira Peninsula in northern Colombia with heavy rain on Friday.

title: An Abortion Ban With Unexpected Consequences for Older Mothers
description: Older women are more likely to carry fetuses with genetic disorders that often can’t be detected until 15 weeks of pregnancy, beyond the limit set in a Senate proposal.

title: Who Is Ales Bialiatski, the Belarusian Nobel Peace Prize Laureate?
description: Ales Bialiatski was part of a dissident group that helped lay the groundwork in the late Soviet period for a movement calling for the independence of Belarus.

title: Tropical Depression Gains Power in the Caribbean
description: Heavy rains were lashing the Guajira Peninsula in northern Colombia and northwestern Venezuela on Friday. Forecasters warned of mudslides and flash flooding in parts of Central America.

title: A Canadian Family Is Seeing the World Before Their Children’s Vision Falters
description: A Canadian family is on a yearlong journey across Asia and Africa because three of their four children have an eye condition that causes blindness.

title: Ukraine Police Find Bodies of 534 Civilians in Recaptured Territory
description: The police have discovered 22 locations that they suspect were used as torture chambers in areas recently reclaimed from Russian control, a Ukrainian official said.

title: The Power of Paxlovid
description: The underuse of Covid treatments is leading to many needless deaths.

title: Ukraine’s Center for Civil Liberties Among 2022 Nobel Peace Prize Winners
description: While the invasion added greater urgency to their work, the group has been tracking disappearances and war crimes for years.

title: The Nobel Peace Prize announcement comes as war rages in Europe.
Memorial, a Nobel Peace Prize Winner, Was Founded to Shed Light on Soviet Russia’s Oppression, Memorial Is Targeted by Putin
description: The organization “is based on the notion that confronting past crimes is essential in preventing new ones,” the Norwegian Nobel Committee said.

title: Brittany Higgins Takes the Stand
description: The first week of the high profile trial in Australia has highlighted some of the difficulties of prosecuting sexual assault cases.

title: Live Updates: Nobel Peace Prize Is Awarded to Rights Advocates in Ukraine, Russia and Belarus
description: There were 343 candidates this year, including 251 people and 92 organizations.

title: In Record Numbers, Venezuelans Risk a Deadly Trek to the U.S. Border
description: Two crises are converging at the perilous land bridge known as the Darién Gap: the economic and humanitarian disaster underway in South America, and the bitter fight over immigration policy in Washington.

title: His Mom Labored on a Winery Under Apartheid. Now, He Owns One.
description: Paul Siguqa grew up hating wineries because his mother toiled in their fields. But last year he opened the only fully Black-owned vineyard in Franschhoek, one of South Africa’s most prestigious wine towns.

title: So You Want to Work Remotely: A Guide
description: As more employers offer flexibility, countries, travel brands and entrepreneurs are stepping in to make working from anywhere easier, with everything from special visas to work pods.

title: How Iranians in New York Are Helping the Protests Abroad
description: “It’s really been a very long process of suffering that has led to this moment,” one activist said.

title: China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Pursuit Causes Mayhem Ahead of Party Conclave
description: Tourists are stranded, residents confined at home. Covid flare-ups and the accompanying lockdowns are causing disruptions ahead of a key Chinese Communist Party meeting.

title: Thailand’s Gun Laws Have Loopholes for Soldiers and Police Officers
description: Such buyers can purchase firearms from the government with fewer checks than those for civilians.

title: Two Russians Who Braved Miles of Open Sea and Landed on an Alaskan Island Request Asylum.
description: The men, apparently part of an exodus of more than 200,000 since Putin announced a new draft, traveled on a vessel from Russia and reached St. Lawrence Island in the Bering Sea.

title: Ireland Opens Decades of Secret Records to Adoptees
description: Thousands of people are being promised new rights to information, a potentially momentous step in a country where unmarried mothers were pressured for decades to give up their babies.

title: Hundreds of Bodies of Civilians Found in Territory Reclaimed by Ukraine
description: The police discovered 22 locations that they suspect were used as torture chambers in areas recently reclaimed from Russian control, a Ukrainian official said.

title: Live Updates: Thailand Turns to Mourning the Dozens Killed in Day-Care Massacre
description: The attack in Nong Bua Lamphu Province, one of the country’s poorest, was the worst mass shooting by a sole perpetrator in Thailand’s history.

title: Russia Lashes Out in Ukraine, Raising Question of What’s Next
description: Facing battlefield setbacks and domestic criticism, the Kremlin has escalated its war, claiming ownership of a nuclear plant and launching more attacks on Ukrainian cities.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Challenges for Vladimir Putin in Russia.

title: ‘They Are in a Panic’: Ukraine’s Troops Size Up the Enemy
description: Ukrainian soldiers are exulting in their smashing of Russian lines in the northeast. They engaged enemy troops up close, and gained confidence from it.

title: Biden Says Risk of Nuclear ‘Armageddon’ Is Highest Since 1962 Crisis
description: The president’s blunt warnings, highly unusual for an American president, were delivered informally to a group of Democratic donors in New York City.

title: Biden Says Risk of Nuclear ‘Armageddon’ Is Highest Since 1962 Crisis
description: The president’s blunt warnings, highly unusual for an American president, were delivered informally to a group of Democratic donors in New York City.

title: Day-Care Massacre in Thailand Was Among the World’s Deadliest
description: The 36 victims included a 2-year-old child and a teacher who was eight months pregnant, the police said. They identified the gunman as a recently fired officer.

title: Saskatchewan Mass Killings Were the Work of One Brother, Police Say
description: The police said Myles Sanderson had killed not just 10 people on an Indigenous reserve and in a nearby village, but also his brother, Damien, who was originally charged with murder.

title: Major Mexican Government Hack Reveals Military Abuse and Spying
description: Hackers infiltrated the Mexican Defense Ministry, publishing millions of emails that detail the military’s growing influence over the civilian government.

title: Biden’s Choice After OPEC Cuts: Woo Saudi Arabia, or Retaliate?
description: The announcement by the Saudi-led OPEC Plus energy cartel that it would slash oil production was widely seen in Washington as a stab in the back of President Biden.
